content: Investments AMA The Fifth Person Asked by AnonymousAsked on 21 Feb 2019Do you invest with projected returns to match what you need for retirement? If not, how much do you plan to accumulate?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Cedric Jamie Soh, Director at Seniorcare.com.sgTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 17 Sep 2019Aiming for $10 million in USD(I know, all financial advisors worth their salt will suggest you save in the currency of the country you are retiring in but I am biased for the USD)So I am pushing for $5m in stocks by 2025.  Going by average stock market returns, ideally, it can double by 2035.0 comments1

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 17 Sep 2019I project based on 40% returns pa. Based on this I'm aiming to retire or at least have the freedom of choice to continue working or not in the next 3 to 5 years.0 comments0
